<RESUME_START>
DIRECTOR OF FINANCE
Professional Summary
Seeking a position in financial/general accounting.
Highly meticulous and reliable Finance Director with an outstanding client service record.
Adept multitasker able to handle a number of cash management projects with professionalism and accuracy.
Strong research skills in optimizing current and efficient cash management team operation.

EXPERIENCE

Director of Finance
May 2016
to
Current
Company Name
— City , State
Manages the day to day accounting department, including hands on monthly close, commission reports, financial statements.
Manages financial tasks, budgeting and overall accounting of the company.
Develop and implement short and long-term financial strategies and tactics in alignment with the company's business plan and strategic initiatives.
Develop and monitor policies and procedures within generally accepted accounting principles and corporate guidelines to ensure sufficient cash flow, reduced operating cost, and increased revenues.
Forecast, monitor performance and prepare analytical information and management reports to enable effective decision making by the CEO.
Manage and develop clear and precise financial records, analyze financial statement while ensuring the integrity of all financials, and maintain internal control.
Manages monthly and yearly closing responsibilities including system closing, journal entry preparation and inventory reconciliation.
Prepare and review all documentation required to meet reporting deadlines.
Provide financial reports and analysis to Executive Staff.
Serve as primary liaison to outside CPA firm for assurance and income tax preparation services.

Resolve cash and position reconciling items on a timely basis.
Evaluate confirms and trades for settlements.
Prepares Cash and Portfolio Reconciliations for equities and fixed income.
Performs daily and monthly analysis and quarterly reporting for institutional investors.
Communicates daily with custodians and prime brokers to resolve trading, operational and accounting issues.
Prepares financial statement for the funds and participate in other Ad Hoc projects as needed.

Maintains and reconciles general ledger, subsidiary ledger and DDA accounts.
Performs a variety of routine accounting functions in accordance with United States Generally Accepted Accounting Principles and Sarbanes Oxley Act.
Prepares financial statement reconciliation report, by analyzing general ledger activity and propose appropriate adjusting entries.
Assists with audits by providing supporting records and documentation.
Prepares, reviews and verifies the accuracy of journal entries and accounting classifications assigned to various records.
Reconciles intercompany and all balance sheet accounts on a monthly basis and report on variances.
Assists in the documentation of processes and establishment of internal controls.
I do evaluate the effectiveness and efficiency of business processes, procedures and accounting assumptions on an ongoing basis.
Leads and participate in various finance ad hoc projects as needed (SAP/eLedger transition).​

<JD_START>
Job Title: Senior Accounting Manager

Location: Dallas, TX

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Accounting/Auditing, Finance

Description:
Compensation: $175,000-$200,000
Company Overview:Our client, a prominent leader in the retail food industry, operates a widespread network of outlets across the globe. Known for their commitment to quality and innovation, they are dedicated to enhancing consumer experiences and continuously adapting to market trends. As part of their mission to refine and expand their financial operations, they are seeking a seasoned Senior Manager, Accounting to guide their accounting team and ensure excellence in financial processes.About This Opportunity:Job Summary:The Senior Manager, Accounting is responsible for managing the organization’s inventory accounting and cost of goods sold, ensuring accuracy and compliance with financial regulations. This role is pivotal in enhancing financial procedures and reports, contributing to the company's overall financial health.Key Duties and Responsibilities:Oversee the completeness and accuracy of financial information relating to inventory and cost transactions.Implement process improvements to streamline inventory and merchandise payables operations.Collaborate across departments to troubleshoot and resolve financial discrepancies and optimize financial reporting.Develop and maintain robust internal controls and compliance with accounting principles.Lead the month-end close process, ensuring timely and accurate financial reconciliations.Provide strategic leadership to the accounting team, fostering skill development and career progression.Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or a closely related field.At least 10 years of accounting experience, with 5+ years in a managerial role within the retail or food industry.Strong understanding of GAAP and other relevant accounting standards.Proficient in using advanced financial software systems and Microsoft Excel.Exceptional analytical, organizational, and leadership skills.Excellent communication abilities to effectively manage internal and external stakeholder relationships.Why Join Us?Our client is not just a leader in the retail food space; they are innovators looking to push the boundaries of what is possible in their industry. They offer:A competitive benefits package including health, dental, and vision insurance.Generous paid time off and flexible working conditions.A supportive environment that fosters professional growth and development.Opportunities to impact the company's strategic financial decisions.Join Our Vision:This role is ideal for a strategic thinker who is passionate about driving financial accuracy and operational efficiency in a fast-paced industry. If you are looking for a challenging role that combines leadership with detailed financial management, consider joining our client's team in Dallas, TX.

Experience Level (if available): None
<JD_END>
